intro: Sisymbrella aspera subsp. munbyana, commonly known as Munby's hoary vetch, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and segmented pods. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. It has hairy, branched stems and small, pinnately divided leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, and it produces elongated, segmented pods that contain several seeds.
